isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 11 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTO-1X707LL/DLL/MLL AND RTO-1X709MLL MODELS - INSTALL - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: Make sure the countershaft assemblies have been marked for proper position, 47-tooth PTO gear in the lower position.

On the drive gear of each countershaft assembly, mark the tooth aligned with the gear keyway and stamped with an "O" for easy identification. A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.

step1.para: Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing purposes ( Figure 213).
Place the lower, 47-tooth PTO gear countershaft, assembly in the case, the drive gear end to the front ( Figure 214).

figure.caption: Figure 214. Drive Gear End To The Front

step1.para: Position as far to the left as possible (the opposite side of the lower reverse idler gear assembly).
Place the upper, 45-tooth PTO gear countershaft, assembly in the case, the drive gear end to the front ( Figure 215).
Position the countershaft assembly as far to the right as possible (the same side as the lower reverse idler gear assembly).
